text: The Jnaneshwari Express derailed on 28 May 2010 in West Midnapore district, West Bengal. It is believed that the track was bombed or sabotaged, damaging it. ==Derailment== At that time The Communist Party of India (Maoist) arranged a four-day bandh in that area. State police said that the track of length about 46 cm was removed by the Maoist-Naxalites. At 1:30pm Jnaneshwari Super Deluxe Express train with 13 carriages which was travelling from Howrah to Mumbai derailed. ==Casualties== At least 148 people were killed and over 200 others were injured. Compensation was announced Rs.5Lakhs for the family of the people who were killed. ==References== Category:2010 crimes Category:2010 disasters in Asia Category:2010 in India Category:Mass murder in Asia Category:Mass murder in the 2010s Category:May 2010 events Category:2010s murders in India Category:Railway accidents in India Category:Terrorist incidents in India in the 2010s Category:West Bengal Category:2010s disasters in India
title: Jnaneswari Express train derailment
